meanings.definition: Disbelief or lack of belief in the existence of God or gods.
meanings.sent1: Her atheism led her to question the existence of any higher power.
meanings.sent2: Many people find comfort in religion, but atheism is a valid belief system as well.
meanings.sent3: His friends joked that his atheism was so strong, he didn't even believe in luck.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of faith, her atheism stood out like a lone tree in a field.
meanings.sent5: The concept of atheism can be a challenging idea for some to grasp.

meanings.definition: Rejection of the belief in the existence of deities.
meanings.sent1: The community's atheism was a bold statement against traditional beliefs.
meanings.sent2: Atheism challenges the notion of divine beings watching over us.
meanings.sent3: Their atheism was so strong, they refused to even participate in superstitions.
meanings.sent4: In a world of gods and goddesses, his atheism was a beacon of rationality.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of atheism can be a refreshing perspective in a complex world.

meanings.definition: The doctrine or belief that there is no God.
meanings.sent1: His atheism was rooted in a firm conviction that no deity existed.
meanings.sent2: Atheism asserts that there is no divine being controlling our lives.
meanings.sent3: Their atheism was so strong, they joked that even the weather was a conspiracy.
meanings.sent4: In a world of prayers, her atheism was a silent protest against blind faith.
meanings.sent5: The clarity of atheism can be a guiding light in a world clouded by uncertainty.
